description:
Little Star is my go-to for delicious deep dish pizza with their signature cornmeal crust. Their pizzas come in two sizes and my group of 4 ladies were pleasantly full after sharing a starter and the larger size deep dish (2 big slices each). Also great is that Little Star allows you to split pizzas so we could easily agree on what to get. During my last visit, we chose half classic and half vegetarian. 

There were lots of options for great starters and salads, and we settled on the brussels sprouts on my last visit. Everyone enjoyed them and the bacon was a great addition. 

Finally, I enjoyed the service. While they were very busy, the waitstaff was all very friendly and, as it was approaching Halloween, they all were in fun costumes. Would definitely recommend.
author: Roya B.

description:
We had the large all-star pizza for $31 and it came with bacon, meatballs, sausage, pepperoni and mozzarella. I came here with one other friend and we split this pizza evenly and boy were we full. Even though two of us eat a lot, I'd recommend getting the small pizza if you want to be comfortable after the meal!

Be prepared to wait 15 - 20 minutes for the pizza to come out, but that's what you come here for! Fresh and great deep dish pizza! It was so delicious and had just the right proportion of cheese, toppings and sauce. The crust is absolutely delicious, one of my favorite parts of the pizza and Little Star did it right. It's a crunch, tasty, yet fluffy crust.

This place is great, I think it's a bit better than Blue Line and a lot better than Patxi's. I'd definitely come back!
author: Christopher L.

description:
It was good pizza but the personal size deep dish was a bit disappointing. It definitely left me wishing I had just ordered a regular deep dish and had left overs. I was wanting to have the food porn cheese pull and it was not even close. Could have used more cheese but was still good pizza. 

Good service and nice environment but parking is a bit hard if you want street parking. 

I'd definitely go again but order a full size deep dish!
author: Drew B.

description: Pizza was aite. It's a good thing my mom taught me how to eat fish with bone in or else I would've choked to death on this piece of plastic IN MY PIZZA!!!!! So disappointed...
author: Karen C.

description:
Good Pizza and good service. Order vegetarian pizza and salad
well done.Will come back.
author: Sammy K.

description: The thin crust pizza here was pretty good and the deep dish pizza was good too.  Parking around the area is a hot mess but it's expected in the Mission.  As for service, we came as a group of around 10 (amazing we were all able to fit but made it work).  They didn't check up on us often and the food took forever to come out.  Speed up the service a bit and it would improve.
author: My Doan C.

description: mbrrrrrrr....I'm drooling as I type this, I came here with a big group and we ordered two deep dishes, one vegetarian and one meat and we had a gluten free pizza and some salad. EVERYTHING was good, my friends came in from Vancouver and they have a pretty good food scene there too but they said this was one of the best pizza's they had. I really wish they would have a deep dish pizza that is gluten free but I understand why they can't. Check Little Star Pizza out, you will not be disappointed.
author: Maninderpal M.

description:
Probably the best deep dish in SF. The only problem is that it will be a long wait for the deep dish but it's so worth it. The corn meal crust is perfection and love doing 1/2 little star and 1/2 big star.  The best part is, it tastes even better as leftover the next day!!
It can get pretty busy especially on weekends for dinner so make sure to make a reso.
Value 4/5
atmosphere 3/5
service 3/5
quality 5/5
15/20
author: Nina S.

description:
Bottom line: The best Chicago style pizza is in San Francisco at Little Star. Case closed.

I have had deep dish at the major spots in Chicago: Giordano's, Gino's, Lou Malnati's, Pequod's and the major spots in the bay area: Zachary's, Patxis, Little Star (Blue Line is the same company and this review applies to them as well) (also note: Uno's, Pizza Chicago, etc are pretenders so they don't count).

After sampling all purveyors of fine Chicago style pizza and traveling to and from Chicago and sacrificing my body to do this review, I have concluded that best deep dish is here at Little Star. I go for the classic and add pepperoni -- the best food you will ever eat. Do it.
author: Alex I.

description:
Probably the best deep dish pizza in SF! The pizzas add full of flavor and the sturdy cornmeal crust is crispy magic. 

The wait for your pizza is long (around 40 minutes) but they tell you upfront and that is expected with the thick crusts of deep dish pizza. They sell half baked pizzas so you can take them home and finish baking them yourself! Or so you can take them on the plane back to LA to enjoy...
author: Dorothy T.

description:
This place lives upto every bit of the hype! Their deep dish pizza (I had the one with the chicken) is simply amazing, and is a meal for 2 in itself.

The staff is friendly, and manage to move through the crowd with ease. I never felt like I had to wait too long for my order to be taken or arrive.

The collection of beer on tap is fine, and goes well with the delicious pizzas.

Everyone in SF needs to come here at least once.
author: Gaurav M.

description:
One of the best pizza places I have been to!! Little Star Pizza Valencia is the best thing I have come across in a while. 

Location: Located in the Mission District of San Francisco, near multiple modes of transportation. 

The Interior: Super nice inside. Does not have that much seating but we went Friday around 6pm and were able to get seated pretty quick. Great for meeting up with friends or if you want to take someone on a date. 

The Food: To start, we got the asparagus and it was super good. Came with tomatoes and parmesan. From there, we got a deep dish that came with Olives, mushrooms and peppers. It had a name but I honestly can't remember it right now. To top it off, I drank an IPA with the meal and the whole experience was amazing.....and beyond filling. 

I don't even have that big of an appetite and I could not stop eating when I was here. 10/10 will be back.
author: Chris O.

description: The Little Star Special was impressive! It could very well be my favorite over Zachary's deep dish pizza after all these years. The cornmeal crust sets them apart. Try it.
author: Danielle Y.

description:
Tried twice both thin crust and deep dish pizza....one conclusion mediocre! 

Definitely not worth the price. Will not come back.
author: anita s.

description:
LITTLE STAR KILLS IT, AGAIN!

This chain is my ultimate favorite in the Bay Area. Was super happy about the whole experience.

The wait was 45 minutes, but this location is great because you can go checkout Clarion Alley while you wait for their call. If you're feeling hungry, SF's most famous bakery (Tartine) is also a few blocks away and open pretty late.

The service is top-notch, and I love the decor here. But the location in Solano has better music, dancing workers, more seats, and a bigger bar.

The pizza is phenomenal. Had the honor of bringing three out of state friends here, and every single one proclaimed the all-star deep dish to be the best pizza they've ever had. Now that was more than I had hoped for. We regretted not ordering a large deep dish, but they were happy with the California thin crust too, which created a great contrast.

I'm really impressed with their deep dish. I haven't been to Chicago, but this place definitely beats Zachary's and the hidden gem Tivoli Caffe, which are both great too. Their pepperoni and sausage are extremely high quality--on par with the sausage I had at the Italian Homemade Company, and the pepperoni is perfectly crisp. The tomatoes were juicy, the seasoning was on point, and the crust was divine. Cornbread crust deep dish from Little Star for life!
author: Tiffany J.

description: We love the deep dish pizza served at Little Star.  We discovered deep dish in Chicago 25 years ago and to my memory, this compares favorably.
author: Beth A.

description:
I was super excited to try Little Star since I love pizza (I mean who doesn't?). However, I thought this place was overhyped.

My friend and I came in on a Saturday night. We had a reservation but we spent a long time looking for parking and were late. Luckily it wasn't very busy and we were seated right away. We ordered a small classic deep dish pizza. We felt like it was just overbearingly filled with sauce. There were barely any toppings or cheese. On the positive side, the crust was good and crunchy. Could probably make some toast and marinara sauce and it'll be the same as what we got. Not bad but disappointing.
author: Becky H.

description:
Best deep dish pizza place I've been to! This is the only place that I know in SF that can make their pizza sauce without onions or garlic. Ordered a vegetarian deep dish, substituted the onions for fresh basil. Came here twice so far. First time, I got a medium size for 2. Second time, I got a personal size for 1. The corn meal crust was crunchy and a surprise like no other. Definitely my go-to when I'm craving pizza.

They also do birthday cheesecake-with-a-candle surprises!
author: Liza M.

description: This might not be fair... I ordered wings from here but the flavors left me unsatisfied... I suspect I should have ordered the pizza.  People seem to like that alot... And it's what they are known for. Maybe l'll try it next time.  The staff seems super nice and are customer satisfaction focused.
author: William L.

description: This place always blows me away. The pizza is sooooo good. Great beer selection too. I like that they have deep dish and thin crust since it's a highly debated topic, satisfying everyone.
author: Brandon N.

description:
We came here on a Sunday night around 6:30pm and luckily had no wait! We were seated right away, however the waiters were very busy running around taking orders and serving people so we had to flag them down for more water and for our check/boxes, but I understand that they were busy and he did apologize. 

We ordered a small order of Caprese as an appetizer and a small All-star deep dish for 2. The Caprese was just OK to me, I've had better so I will most likely not order this again. The All-star deep dish pizza has bacon, meatballs, sausage, pepperoni, mozzarella, and provolone and it was delicious! Probably the best deep dish I've had so far and I would definitely recommend it!
author: Bailey L.

description: This is me and my partner's favorite pizza spot in SF. We particularly like the Mission location since it takes reservations, but they also have a different menu than the Divisidero location. We prefer the Valencia location's meat deep dish pizza, the All-Star, to the Divisidero location's Meateor since it's more meat and less onion. They also have fantastic salads, and the thin crust pizzas are nice and light (but not the star of the show)--good for sharing if you go with a group and getting multiple deep dish pizzas seems to gluttonous.
author: Linda W.

description:
Little Star Yay!
Grubhub Boo!

Fed 9 of us last night. Ages from 35 to 85. Two deep dish and two thin crust. Everyone, even my foodies loved them. 

I did the Grubhub order the night before, and the bottom line is it never got to the restaurant.  First GH said it was ordered for pickup, but of course when we arrived they had to find and then start the order. 

However, Little Star jumped right on it, the mgr made a great customer service gesture, and 4 fabulous pizzas were in our hands in 25 minutes. 

Bottom line: You will enjoy Little Star pizza, but use another delivery service. The staff confirmed GH is "glitchy". 

As well, Grubhub refunded the charge promptly and apologized for the inconvenience. 

Cheers!
author: David S.

description: Without a doubt, one of the worst restaurant experience I've ever had. After using the Divisidaro location for years and being VERY happy, I was at a party and the host wanted pizza delivery suggestions. I suggested Little Star and he called Caviar to place an order, which apparently automatically routes to this location. Many vegetarians at this party (including me) and one of the deep dishes is labeled "Cheese Only". Two vegetarians went through a whole slice. I bit into a slice and immediately knew there was meat in there. The other two thought it was some exotic vegetable or fake meat because they are not familiar with Little Star. I called the location to complain and was on hold for 10 minutes. Hung up, called back and eventually someone picked up - I heard people talking and background noise but nobody ever came to the phone. Called back a third time and hung up after ten minutes to write this review. Horrible place. Vegetarians- avoid at all costs.
author: Richard E.

description: Most delicious deep dish pizza in the area, fresh garlic and basil made it more delicious
author: Siddhi P.

description:
Hmm, so this is sort of an interesting review from my standpoint.

I've been to little star/the star/blue line dozens of times, so I know how the pizza is supposed to taste and for the most part I really like it (it's my second favorite deep dish pizza).  Yesterday evening which also happened to be my birthday (I didn't tell them this) the large deep dish pizza that we got came out sub par.  The crust was hard as a rock, well maybe not rock hard, but I couldn't simply cut through it with a knife.  I had to stab it with a knife and push really hard just to crack through and the crust was more hard cracker like in texture, but obviously much thicker.  It was like crunching on a hard bavarian pretzel on the bottom and the edges.  There were also some black burned looking portions on the top (luckily they didn't taste burned).  We waited a long time for the pizza, probably 45 minutes or more.  They say it can take up to that long, but the dining room wasn't particularly busy, but I guess it was full.  It did seem like they had a ton of take out orders though.  Anyway, I'm just setting the scene here, not complaining about how long the pizza took.

Anyway, we were both sort of disappointed with the pizza, it was obviously overdone.  I usually don't make comments or complain at restaurants, but the disappointed face across from me and the fact that it was my birthday and I was looking forward to having a great pizza motivated me to at least let them know that the crust was really hard and overdone.  I told them that we didn't want to send it back b/c we didn't have time to wait for another one, so we would just keep it and I just wanted to let them know.

Without any issues they offered to take it off of our bill!  I was shocked and grateful.  They also took off the order of broccolini that we ordered, which was unnecessary and much appreciated.  Wow.  I will continue to be a loyal customer with them having this type of attitude and approach.  I have full confidence that I will be taken care of each and every time I go here.  That is why this is a 5 star review, not b/c of the pizza on this trip, but b/c of the attitude of the staff and restaurant as a whole.

If the manager is reading this, I just want to say thank you once again.

-Ty
author: Ty C.

description: This review is solely based off the food we ordered from here. We ordered here through door dash today and it was just as the yelp ratings suggested. Perfect blend of crispy and soft. We ordered the thin crust pizza and it's was full of flavor . We ordered 1 cheese and 1 mushroom olive and it was the perfect amount. 2 large is perfect for 5-6 hungry adults. Will definitely have to visit the location next time I'm in Valencia neighborhood! If you're undecided on pizza and this is one of the contenders, just go with this place. You'll thank me later
author: Rocky H.

description:
This review is for the thin crust only. My partner does not like deep dish so we opted for the thin crust. The crust was delicious. We also ordered the brocallini which was good, but I've had better. 
The pizza here is great, and we found a great malbec on the wine list. We would definitely eat here again if in the area
author: Kia Marie N.

description:
Decent pizza in the Mission!! 
Wait was pretty long - 50 mins after having been seated but they were constantly checking on us and offered us a complimentary drink for the long wait. 
We didn't reserve a table and got seated right away. Good experience all in all.
author: Kinga H.

description: Fantastic little place with friendly staff and delicious deep dish pizza! Reasonably priced too.
author: Vikram N.

description: I heard good things about Little Star Pizza from a friend and was excited to try it. We got seated immediately at 7:30 pm and given time to look at the menu. We got a small deep dish Classic and a small thin crust Italian. The Classic was huge and full of sausage, green bell peppers and sauce. The crust was thick and held up to all the ingredients on top with no sag at all. It was a good deep dish pizza, and I'm excited to try the other pies. The highlight of the night was the thin crust Italian. It was an Italian sandwich on a pizza, and it was everything I hoped for and more. All the ingredients worked really well together and didn't clash with one another at all. It was all really cohesive, and I had to stop myself from eating more. Definitely going to be coming back.
author: Brandon T.

description: Loving little star! Ray was so fire and was totally awesome! The pizza was amazing, service was amazing, and I can't wait to come back. :P
author: M R.

description:
I have been a fan of Little Star since it first opened. Some things have changed... but one thing that hasn't is their amazing pizza!!! 

In the past, I dreaded coming here because of the long wait. But recently, they have allowed reservations through OPEN TABLE at the Valencia location! More time to catch a drink at one of the bars on 16th while you wait for friends! 

This is my top favorite deep dish for flavor AND crust. The crust is not doughy, but crispy, airy, and buttery. A delight.

Check out their local and imported beer and wine list. 

Things that make me happy: 

We were allowed to sit and order a pizza while our friend was looking for parking. 

Björk's album "Post" was playing the whole time. 

The exposed brick wall gives this place warmth in contrast with its cool exterior. Check out their new mural outside!
author: Mitzi G.

description:
Overall: disappointment. 

Maybe it was overhyped. It was a complete letdown for me. 

Their menu was very inflexible. I wanted to order a pizza and asked to swap out an ingredient, and the server was unwilling to accommodate. It wasn't anything out of reason. Basically, a "take it as it is, or pick something else" type of attitude. Probably won't return. Wouldn't recommend the establishment. There are plenty of other chicago style pizza joints with better service and selection.
author: Melissa J.

description: Little Star FOR THE WIN. Can I just rave on their cornmeal deep dish it's so ooey gooey and comforting and like new worlds and old worlds collide in the best possible cheesy way. And they have vegan options for everything and a good happy hour and Rayanna and Raven are total stars. The seasonal thin crust is my go to, any salad I'm feelin that day and the deep dish is for the family nights. Go say what up to the crew and feel like a BIG STAR AT LITTLE STAR.
author: Marina M.

description: Love the pizza and salads... food gets a 5 star.  But my visit was tarnished w the server in the green shirt.  Rude,. unwelcoming.
author: Vicky A.

description:
The pizza is good but not mind blowing. Far from real Chicago deep dish flavor. The crust was on the dry side and the overall flavors were just a bit lack luster. 

We got the little star and added sausage which helped with flavor and also got the bbq chicken. Both were decent but there is better deep dish at other places in SF. The chopped salad was a joke, it was mainly iceberg with very little fixings or dressing. Thankfully our server was very kind and took it off the bill along with our 2 glasses of wine to make up for it. 

Great service but the pizza was just ok. Other types of salads we saw coming out looked really good and had lots of the fixings on it. Just avoid that particular salad. We'll give it another shot and make some different choices another time.
author: SHELLEY M.

description:
Coming from someone who's lactose intolerant, very rarely is consuming dairy worth the *ahem* after effects. However, Little Star makes the cut!

If you're not looking to dine in, make sure to call in roughly an hour ahead of time as the wait for your pie can be quite long. I've had Little Star a number of times, and whether you find yourself fancying deep-dish or thin-crust or if you're a carnivore or vegetarian, you can't go wrong here!
author: Tyler W.

description: Very good food. But the music is so loud. I wanted to leave within 5min after staying there.
author: Shub C.

description:
Well they allow dogs in dining room which is against health codes and just gross. I don't like eating with someone's dog in the dining room and trying to beg for food from me. This place should follow the law and not allow.
PS: I knew they would come back and say it was a service dog. That's laughable that they claim to check papers for every dog. It's illegal to ask an owner of a service dog for proof. You can legally only ask 2 questions: whether the dog is required because of a disability, and what work the dog is trained to perform. So clearly that reply was a lie. Thanks for being dishonest!

Also FYI in CA the designation of "therapy dog," "comfort dog," "emotional anxiety dog" are not considered a "service dog" when it comes to food facilities according to Penny Si, the ADA coordinator for SFPD.
author: Cody H.

description:
This place was pretty good. We had a deep dish and a thin crust pizza. Both had great crusts and a good flavorful sauce. Salads were also good. My table had the Caesar the Greek and the chopped. All were liked. 

The place is very small so get a reservation or plan to wait. Also, they are pretty heavy on crafty type beers. So, don't plan on a macro beer. 

I'd go 5 stars for food but the service and price point were a both below best in class for a pizza restaurant. I guess everything is expensive in San Fran though.
author: Todd B.

description: I ordered from Door Dash which I don't recommend because they got our order mixed up twice in one night! Fortunately Dave the manager was able to accommodate the mix up. The mozzarella pizza was OK (pictured). The chicken wings were OK which didn't have much flavor and looked burnt which is why I am only giving 4 stars. The half white and All Star pizza (not pictured) was amazing! By the third delivery we were so hungry we forgot to take a picture. I would definitely order here again but not using Door Dash!
author: Maria Gracielle Y.

description: so freaking goooodddd. our server was very nice and helpful. i got a classic cheese only deep dish and it was a dream come truelove the vibe of the place. it's on the pricier side but let's be honest what's not on the pricier side in sf?? haha all in all such a good time at little star definitely coming back 10/10
author: Alyssa J.

description: Most authentic deep dish in the Bay Area according to all my Chicago friends. Pizza is delicious. Apps are great too.
author: Benjamin D.

description:
Cute pizza place on Valencia street.

We came here because we wanted to watch the game, they had a TV over there bar area.
The TV was a little small but it did the job.

The pizza we ordered was half classic deep dish and half all star deep dish and it was really good I especially liked the crust.

The only thing I was disappointed about was that they only serve beer and wine, other than that great service and great food.
author: Mayumi H.

description: Second time eating at Little Star on Valencia. The salad and garlic sourdough were meh, but the biggest disappointment was the pizza itself: sooooo acidic it was almost impossible to eat, and left us with stomach pain afterwards. It tasted like someone had dumped way too much vinegar in the tomatoes, and I think the peppers may have been pickled as well. The pie didn't have enough cheese on it to balance out the acidity. Ouch.
author: Lindsay R.

description:
The Customer Service Experience: The customer service is what makes this a 3 star for me. Most likely won't be coming back or recommending this location to out of town guests. I had family and friends visiting me and my cousin who is pregnant was craving pizza. I recommended going to Little Star and hyped it up (I've been several times). 

We arrive and NO ONE acknowledges us for a good 10 minutes, now if it were busy I'd understand. There were only 3 tables with patrons. So my pregnant cousin had to ask someone behind the bar for some attention. Finally the hostess comes out, hardly makes eye contact with me and cracks a half smile that's more like an annoyance that we had a large party coming in. I was so close to having us leave by that point. But we stayed. We were a party of 8. The hostess said we had to wait for everyone in the party to arrive to be seated. Literally at this point there's only 2 tables with patrons. You have a pregnant lady wait while you have literally over half of your pizza joint empty. Made no sense to me on a non-busy night. Sorry that's just awful customer service already as if not being acknowledged on a non busy night wasn't bad enough. 

Finally everyone arrives. We had 3 little munchkins under the age of 5 with us. We could tell the hostess was just annoyed with us and probably due to having kids there later in the evening. Mind you the kids were well behaved just watching cartoons and eating pizza. I guess this location isn't kid nor people friendly. The hostess didn't seem to like people in general I think. 

The Food Experience: We had Cesar salad, cheese thin crust, Little Star deep dish, and the Italian combo thin crust. Honestly everything was good. A solid 3.5/4 stars. Fortunately I didn't disappoint my family and friends so the pizza met their expectations. Nothing bad to say about the food experience. 

I've been to other Little Star locations and I've had a positive experience with the customer service and the food. I'll return for the food but never to this location. Half the experience anywhere when dining out is the customer service experience so I would encourage management to work on that with the employees. I was so embarrassed for my out of town guests to have experienced such rude service. Especially when we spent $200 with tip.
author: Eidit C.

description: Deep dish pizza, vegan cheese as an option, AND absolutely delicious? Yes, please! I'll be seeing you again, Little Star.
author: Rob M.

description: Good salads and pizzas. I didn't try the deep dish as I am not a fan of this kind of pizza.
author: Ludo Q.

description:
In my Opinion, this reminds me a lot of actual Chicago Style Deep-Dish Pizza.

This place is good for families, dates, dinners, etc! 

The Caprese is pretty creative, talk about a Do-It-Yourself kinda thing. 

You will not be disappointed if you give this place ago! The All-Star Deep-Dish (All-Meat) is such an amazing style Pizza! I would definitely give that a HUGE GO! 

Patxi's is not bad, but I think this place is better in terms of Quantity and Richness of their Deep Dish!
author: Erito S.

description:
Great pizza!

Tried this place for the first time - as part of a small group. 
The deep dish pizza with roasted red pepper and pesto was ... spectacular.
Great crust, great combination of flavors, and beautifully presented.  
Could not have asked for more.
Also had:
an Old School deep dish
Caprese salad
Mixed salad
Meatballs
All of those were very good too, with generous portions.

Dining room was clean and tables nicely spaced.  Service was prompt at lunchtime, although it does take awhile for the deep dish to cook.  

This is a keeper.
author: Lewis C.

description:
The good: the pizza!
The bad: getting out orders wrong!
The ugly: service was non-existent.
                 I had to be the waiter for our table
The worst: I sent an email to Little Star Valencia to let them know about our experience.
I was hoping to get feedback from them but still no feedback.
author: Ji k.

description:
The food and wine were exceptional, the service was great, ambience and decor were lovely. 

Our large deep-dish vegetarian pizza was ordered with both regular and vegan cheese, but light on both. No problem. Tasting the Sangeovese wine before ordering it? No problem.

Prices a bit high, but expected for this place and level of restaurant and we were out on a splurge night to celebrate a birthday. Definitely worth it!

What I don't at all like, though it's common for high-end restaurants, is the line-item charge on our bill for their healthcare expenses. I find this socially offensive and politically regressive. If you're not going to explicitly charge for your other costs (e.g., food, labor, utilities, rent, etc.), whihc would be absurd, you should not single out this; it should be built into your business model and leave us out of it.
author: Veg V.

description: It's a beautiful, friendly place, serves and seating was fast. Garlic bread was awesome but the deep dish pizza was not good :/ it tasted like my granny spaghetti where she put beer in. Other then that it was good but it wasn't worth $40
author: Vanessa G.

description:
Great pizza, great service! Ray is the best!

My only complaint is the names are a bit confusing. Please work out a naming scheme that is more clear.
author: Andrew F.

description: Ordered the deep dish pizza with green peppers, roasted garlic, sausage and pepperoni. The crust is made of cornbread, it was a little hard and maybe over cooked. It's good pizza but not $32 good. If going deep dish I actually prefer Patxi's because I'm not a big fan of the cornbread crust.
author: Tom P.

description:
They serve the best deep dish pizzas in SF 
Always order for take out . And my fav ever is "all star " pizza  , fantastic !
author: Kamthong N.

description:
Came here last Friday with a group of 6. We had a reservation, but they messed up the time. Nonetheless they were able to get us a table shortly while we waited at the bar. And they even gave us a discount, so considerate. That's wassup. 

Ok now into the food. If you like deep dish pizza, this is THE place in the city. I've been to the location in Albany but the pizza here was so much better! We had the Little star and the All star deep dish. Also we tried their caprese, garlic bread and the eggplant special for appetizers. Both of the pizza were soooo good, if you're a vegetarian the little star is perfect and for the meat lovers - the all star! Oh yea also, they had black butte porter from deschutes brewery! Cherry on top!

All the stuff are super friendly, checking on us every now and then, but not in an annoying way you know.
author: Namuun B.

description: This is my favorite pizza place in town. The deep dish pizza is amazing. I love the cornmeal crust. Staff is always super nice.
author: Bryan H.

description: Best pizza in SF. Get the Little Star, a bottle of red,  and the caprese salad and you're set. Miss this place a lot since I moved out of the city three years ago and always visit when I'm in town.
author: Gabby R.

description: We had the large thin crust classic pizza and it was very delicious. Our waiter kept checking up with us as every waiter should and provided great customer service. Would definitely come back if I'm ever in the area again, yummmmmm.
author: Jonathan R.

description:
Little Star has both deep dish and thin crust pizza. The yellow squash thin crust pizza is an absolute must. It has squash and sun dried tomatoes and is perfection! I loved it so much!

I'm not the biggest deep dish fan, but for others, I imagine it's absolute cheesy pizza heaven. The crust is cornbread and goes very well with honey. Ask for some to slather your leftover crush with. We got the pollo pizza. It was very tasty and the chicken was nice and moist. 

They also have affordable bottles of wine. We shared a bottle amongst the three of us and it was only $24. They also have cans of PBR for $2.50. 

So why only four stars? I asked the waiter to box my plate and he nodded his head and took my plate, but then when he came back with our large deep dish pizza I asked him where my take out was and he had thrown it away. My plate had an untouched slice of pizza on it as well as half of a deep dish slice so I was pretty disappointed.
author: Courtney O.

description:
Its September 23, 2016 and Octoberfest By the Bay is in full swing in the city. I stop by here with a couple friends for my favorite deep dish on the planet. 8:00pm and a half hour wait... No worries though there is a small bar at the front and a waiting area where the time will pass quickly.

One of the group is stylishly late for the 8pm dinner date and so it was perfect timing for him. My favorite is the classic deep dish "little star" pizza. But this time we agree on a deep dish with olives and chicken. Its great as they all are. I think its probably not possible to pick some combination that is less than awesome here.

This place is refreshing... its not a huge chain like Paxtis... and feels more special when you go as it isn't available everywhere. The people working here are top notch young people that appear to love their jobs - from the hosts to the servers. 

As far as I know the story of little star is of two brothers: one owns all the "Little Star Pizzas" and the other owns "The Star" pizza in Oakland. I'm not sure of the story but that is rumor on the street.

I doubt there will be any leftovers - but if there is you will all be fighting over who gets to take it home. This place will test your friendships on a couple of different levels: which toppings to agree on and who gets the last slice to take home. Its like playing a game of poker with your friends - their real personalities surface.
author: Stefan T.

description:
Parking can be rough, but you knew that already (it's in the mission)
I would say the crust here is superior to Zachary's, its main competition in the area, in that it's less dense and heavy (I think it's the cornmeal base). I think Zach's does a little better in terms of toppings, but this isn't about Little Star vs. Zachary's. 
Anyway, group of 6, they let us sit even though our whole party wasn't there (yay)
We also brought a cake in, so they charged a cakeage fee, but were really nice about sticking it in the fridge.

Anyway, we had a Greek salad, which wasn't really anything to write home about. It felt good to have a little bit of greens before the incoming deep dish bomb.

For 6 of us, we split one large little star and one small mediterranean. The little star is vegetarian, the med is not. Overall, the toppings (though they weren't on top... hmm) weren't the star of the show. The sauce was really good with a nice tang.

For 6 of us, including cakeage, it ended up being about 140. If you're in the mission and craving pizza, definitely go here!
author: Samir K.

description: Ok so I heard that this place was the best pizza in San Francisco. I just moved to the area a couple of months ago, but I can definitely say it one of the best pizzas I've had since moving here. Delicious and highly recommended! Get a pitcher of beer with your pizza!!! The staff was friendly and efficient.
author: Lyndon G.

description:
With time, things change. Change is good. 

Around 8 years ago, in my early Yelp days, I visited Little Star on Divisadero with a bunch of Yelpers. We ordered a variety of pizzas and quickly ate them. Everyone had such positive things to say and they reviewed them.

I didn't write a review. I didn't like what I ate. I had heartburn that night and went to the ER thinking it was a heart attack. I never experienced heartburn before. So embarrassing. 

Recently another Yelper suggested I try Little Star again so I placed a to-go order for me and my daughters. 

Wow. Ok you know how your palette changes with age? Apparently I had the best pizza they've ever made or my palette has changed. 

I bravely ordered the classic deep dish because I don't like mushrooms or onions but wanted to be fair when I tried Little Star again. I was willing to be open minded. 

That classic deep dish was delicious! It was wonderfully balanced with earthy, mildly spicy, tangy layers around the rich cheese. Mmmm. So good! 

I also ordered a thin crust pepperoni. 

I'm glad I tried Little Star again because it was worth the money and the calories. 

I now understand and agree with what everyone has been and is raving about. 

My family can't wait to have pizza here again but next time? We are dining in.
author: Jennifer C P.

description:
This is fantastic deep dish pizza, and I've lived in Chicago so I know what I'm talking about.  So good.  So flavorful.  

They put a lot of care into their pizza, which is something California needs to learn how to do as a state (the pizza in Cali sucks.) 

Little Star knows how to make great pies.  Keep up the great work.
author: Andrew P.

description: Ooh Barracuda, this is Little Star Pizza is quite a little gem for deep dish pizza in San Francisco. Be sure to stop by, make a reservation, and have a good savory pizza while on a night on the town.
author: Deepak S.

description: Second time here, pizza is great, everything else is a bit lackluster. The salads were bland and the service was spotty but it was mostly due to how busy it was. Also waiting in line for the 1 bathroom gets a little old. I would think this place is best suited for take out of pizza only
author: Joshua E.

description: Love their pizza. A bit pricey, but worth the splurge every once in awhile. They put in our order wrong and as soon as they realized it, they notified us and gave us a break on the pizza. They serve craft beer-yay! The roasted garlic appetizer was delicious and the pizza is consistent.
author: d p.

description:
Best replacement pizza if you can't have Uno Pizzeria and Grill from Chicago. Good crust!. Had the Goddess salad and it, too, was terrific.

Service from Ruben was outstanding and well timed. They were out of the Temperanillo, so we had the Malbec, which was more than adequate.

We can't wait to return.
author: Reyn J.

description:
Huge fan of Little Star! I've been to the Star on Grand (in Oakland) a bunch, and it's my favorite pizza. Was more than happy to come and try out this location. It was my first meal after completing the Whole 30 (no dairy/carbs for 30 days) so I was especially looking forward to this :) 

Service was great. Came at 7PM on a Thursday and we were seated immediately. There's a bar in front, too. We ordered a bottle of Middle Earth wine (#LOTR) and split the Meatball deep-dish. Both were excellent. I feel like some other deep dish pizza places take forever to get the pizza out (hello, Patxi's), but it didn't feel like we waited very long at all for our pizza to be ready. 

It's an easy walk from 16th St Mission BART. One bathroom in the back, which is gender-neutral. I will definitely be back!
author: Shoshana G.

description:
Me and my fiancé are pizza lovers and we are always trying to find new good ones and definitely this was a great pizza! We both tried the deep dish and we loved it.
I think the service could have been better since our server was a little rude and she was rushing us, but we will definitely come back for the food and to give another chance on the service :)
author: Sabrina V.

description: Great pizza place prob the best in the city actually coming from a girl that lived in chicago for 12 years the thin cornmeal crust was delish!!
author: Adrienne G.

description:
Little Star has some real good deep dish pizza. I finally got the chance to try this place over the weekend and WOW, I've been missing out. I love pizza in all sizes, colors, and shapes.  Little Star gives you the flexibility to do whatever you'd please with your pizza (flat pizza/deep dish pizza/add custom ingredients/custom sauce/custom cheese...you ask and they'll customize the crap out of it for you.)

Food:
We made our own pizza, because well we're picky people. I got a deep dish pizza (SMALL) with: sausage, pepperoni, mozzarella, and basil. You start off with the pizza template for $15, and any additional ingredient is an extra $2. The sausage and the basil are both equal in pricing, which I thought was interesting. I think in the future I will add a bunch of meats and reduce the veggies. Don't tell my mother! But yes, I was amazingly surprised that this pizza spot lived up to its expectations and hype. Such yummy deep dish pizza. I want to come back already and it hasn't even been 3 days!  The size Small was just enough food for 2 people, 2 hungry people.

Service:
We visited on a Friday night around 8:30pm. Hostess estimated a 25 minute wait...but we were seated in less than 10 mins. Yay! I think a lot of parties give up on waiting or decide to check out other restaurants in the vicinity, reducing the wait time. All the employees from the hostess to our waiter were incredibly friendly and helpful, from asking for recommendations to going out of their way to make sure we had a great dining experience.

Atmosphere:
Little Star is a super trendy and hipster place. Lots of thick rimmed glasses, plaid shirts, and wine drinkers. It's a super cozy spot, making it an ideal place for a date. I probably wouldn't do big parties here due to the space limitation, but definitely will be back on a date. I liked that even though the space is limited you can still clearly hear the person sitting across from you, which seems to be an issue in a lot of smaller SF restaurants. 

Can't wait to be back for some more pizza!
author: Stefany Z.

description:
I have been to this location quite a few times over the years and never had a problem but tonight was pretty crazy. We didn't mind waiting for a table but the front bar area was chaotic AF. It was just this swell of hangry folks trying to pick up their orders while jostling with all these different delivery service guys doing the same. The counter person was just yelling over and over for people to be orderly. One guy got into it with another customer and ended up storming out, cussing up a storm. Yikes. 

By the time we ended up getting seated ourselves and having our food brought out to our table (we pre-ordered during our initial wait like they suggested), we were closing in at about a 1 hour and 50 minute wait. We ended up having to miss our movie at the Roxie because we were just too hungry to argue. We also didn't want to be dicks to the nice staff and walk out on the pre-order.  :(

I'm hoping that tonight was just an anomaly but Little Star has gotta work out a better system with fulfilling both dine in and take out orders in a more efficient manner.
author: J. L.

description: Great staff and casual ambience. This is my favorite neighboring hang-out spot: to have beer and great pizza on the weekend.
author: Meo M.

description:
I had heard great things about Little Star before, so I was excited to give it a try recently. For me, I feel like deep dish pizza can be a hit or miss experience, but I ended up really enjoying the pizza here. We got a couple different deep dish pizzas to split among us, which were The Classic (with meat) and Little Star (veggie). Both were actually really tasty, and I think I would pass them along as recommendations to try.

Also for a crowded restaurant, I would have to say that the service was phenomenal! Water was always refilled (without having to ask even once!) and our server was very attentive without being overbearing. 

Great experience here my first time, and would love to return!
author: Daniel H.

description:
When you run through town  delivering food orders you come a cross hidden jewel. LITTLE STAR PIZZA 
has come to San Jose  the only way that you can order from them is from DOORDASH  so remember that Little Star Pizza is a click and a Dash a Way.

Yisel Diaz.
author: Yisel D.

description: Best crust around...but you pay for it. I'm from the East Coast where we know our thin crust, but I have to say their deep dish is legit. The staff is super down too. They do carryout as well and I appreciate their honest time estimate. If you do get there earlier than they say, they do have a nice waiting area.
author: Laurisha C.

description: Great Pizza. The waiters are a little Emo
author: Matt S.

description: 2 stars because the pizza is actually good, but it took Way TOO long. and when I say long, it took literally 58 minutes from the time we ordered, and we were literally the only ones there. Meanwhile, there were SO many workers in the restaurant. I just don't get it. Their menu says it can take UP TO 45 minutes on a busy day, but 58 minutes for only 1 table? I just can't.
author: Kristine H.

description: This place was great but however I wouldn't say that it was the best. The food was definitely delicious but I don't think I'd come again simply because of the price. I tried their spicy baked wings and their all-star deep dish pizza and the total amounted to about $40. Spicy wings were spicy and their all-star was meaty. I would recommend that you at least give this place a try with a group of friends.
author: Jimmy Y.

description: I have only ever gotten my pizzas to go, and I've never had an issue with them! Very consistent, quick, polite, and ready to go! Thanks for making it easy!
author: Marty M.

description: It is a pretty good pizza! The place is great to get together with some friends and get a BIG pitcher of hefeweizen  , it is damn good over there !
author: Alex B.

description: I've had this one on my "to try" list for awhile and finally came into the city this week and was able to try. Big fan of deep dish and had never tried cornmeal crust before. I ordered the classic - sausage, mushroom, onion and green pepper - and it was quite tasty. Turns out cornmeal crust is a a bit harder than I was expecting - overall pizza was solid and yummy, but I don't think I'll be seeking out cornmeal crust again. Wasn't bad, just not my thing. Service was great and it's a funky little spot - worth checking out.
author: Blaine W.

description: Take it from a pizza fan... Little Star does it right! Both the deep dish + thin crust are mouth-watering.... especially impressed with how the flavors + ingredients are layered in the thin crust
author: Dan R.

description:
I really do like this place alot. We usually get there classic deep dish which is so filling and delicious. The sauce is so yummy and they are not afraid to load it up with toppings. This last time we went there we got the white pie and it's a thin crust with tomatoes and zucchini with a white sauce. We would totally get that again! 

Everyone who works there is very polite and kind. It's a little hipstery but if you v and get over that and just get the pizza, you will not be disappointed.
author: Lizzie D.

description: This is our go to for pizza in San Francisco. Their deep dish with corn crust is amazing. Prices are a little high but worth it.
author: Wade W.

description:
If you're having pizza problems, I feel bad for you son.

I got 99 problems, but Little Star Pizza's cornmeal crust ain't one!
author: Jennifer K.

description:
Updated: the restaurant contacted me with apologies and had me try their wings in house on the house. they're really good, just go in and eat them. 


Ordered this mess through a delivery service and foolishly chose to get wings and meatballs in addition to my pizza. Biggest mistake of my weekend, when they arrived they were charred and burnt to all hell plus cold (which I expect) but these were beyond saving. 

Who knows what they're like in house but for god sake don't order them for delivery.
author: Sarah J.

description: Ordered delivery. They sent us - no joke, slices of pizza that were not from the same pizza (they didn't fit together) and tasted like it had been made the day before and ever so SLIGHTLY heated back up before being sent over to us. Ordered through Door dash and they only had it for 15 minutes, so I know the temperature didn't have anything to do with them. Will never order again.
author: Emily K.

description: The service is a little slow. We want for food for more than 30 minutes even non-busy lunch time.
author: Jenny C.

description: The deep dish pizzas are simply amazing but you always have to wait 15-20min before having your table even when you booked before.
author: Lucas F.

description: Little Star Valencia never disappoints! By far the best pizza in San Fransisco! If you're craving a chigago style deep dish pizza (cornmeal crust of course) this is the place to go. Service was 5 star to match the food. Ray was friendly and knowledgeable. I highly recommend!
author: Lester G.

description: I visited this pizza spot with one of my friends  The ambiance is chic but the soundtrack of Donna Summer hits and Dazz Band throwbacks kept it from feeling too hipster. We arrived right when it opened but the lunch rush never got too crazy.  We enjoyed garlic bread(our server had to instruct us on pressing out the cloves over the butter) and individual personal pizzas. We were treated to deep dish deliciousness! I enjoyed a Little Star which featured tomatoes, spinach, ricotta and garlic. My daughter had her cheese pizza. That cornmeal crust had the right crispiness to it.
author: Julie C.

description:
Absolutely incredible gluten free pizza (tastes just like the tastiest glutinous pizza you know and love), but also absolutely incredible service. Has been our Friday treat for quite a while!

Want to give a shout out to Ronny, the manager: we got the wrong order through Caviar and he was communicative, double checked the order and then *hand delivered* a replacement. 

If you are Ronny's boss and are reading this right now, give this man a promotion! LittleStar4Life!
author: Raph D.

description: Best pizza in town! The place is always crazy busy but Ray was amazing! Her customer service is on point, thanks Ray!
author: Jose B.

description: Pizza was okay, not great. Salads and roasted cauliflower were far better. In fact, pizza was more flavorful the next day. This is a VERY loud place which made conversation infuriating.
author: Katherine W.

description: Im starting to become a regular here the pizza is so tasty. They have some really great people working there as well. Jose is the man!
author: Travis S.

description:
When it comes to carbs, I'm always a fan of the more the merrier which is absolutely the reason why I'm so infatuated with Little Star Pizza.

Their deep dish is perfect, with just the right balance of a crunchy, melt-in-your-mouth exterior and the pillowy soft interior. The tomato sauce is zesty and generous and you can't go wrong with any of the toppings (I'm partial to their namesake with mushrooms, onions, spinach, ricotta and feta). I always walk in thinking that I want a large pizza but it's so filling that a small pizza is the perfect plate for two.

For veggie lovers, I highly recommend the mixed salad. I'm not sure what type of witchcraft they put in to make these fresh greens taste so tasty and tangy but I seriously consumed a weeks worth of veggies with a serving. It was that good!

Definitely a fun, casual, crowd pleasing stop whenever you are in SF. I suggest arriving a bit later in the dinner hour to avoid the rush!
author: Kimberly S.

description:
I've been so looking forward to eating here for so long because of how much everyone raves about their pizzas. Maybe my hopes were too high, but I was sorely disappointed. My standards were already pretty high, since eating deep dish pizzas in Chicago. 

We came here when they just opened on a Saturday and grabbed a seat at one of the tables. We ordered the Caprese Salad, Spicy Chicken Wings, and a small Little Star w/ sausage added. 

Caprese Salad: (3/5) the ingredients weren't as fresh as I would have hoped 
Spicy Chicken Wings: (4/5) some of the wings were smaller, but it's great that the appetizer comes with a pound of wings and not a number 
Little Star w/ sausage: (1/5) nothing compared to the pizza I've had in Chicago. There wasn't much sauce, nor sausage. I definitely didn't feel as though I got my money's worth. 

If I were to get a Chicago deep dish in San Francisco, I would just head to Patxi's to satisfy my craving.
author: Melanie H.

description: If you like paying a lot of money to eat tomato soup on greasy ass cornbread while surrounded by affluent anglos then you will love what Little Star refers to as pizza, but it's nigh inedible for anyone that wasn't raised on Hot Pockets and weed. I'm glad there's a fluttering choir of tatted-up moths dedicated to this zapper lamp of laziness because their trustafarian customers truly deserve to be fleeced repeatedly, but I do wish they'd go do it in on Lombard instead. All the chill startup bros take Uber instead of razor scooters now so they can go just about anywhere.
author: Nicholas J.

description: Very high-quality pizza I've been ordering for these guys for discernment time the last time I ordered for a pick up they estimated a little wrong I'm not super upset but I did  I did pick it up about 1015 minutes after it been made date do you keep it warm but because the estimated the time wrong it was not very fresh specially a deep - - - - deep dish pizza needs to be super warm in order to enjoy
author: Aviad B.

description:
Ordered Little Star for the first time & was a little disappointed with the delivery process. Ordering online was fairly simple, their menu is easy to navigate and options can easily be added. My group of friends and I were shocked when pineapple was not offered as a topping, however. We ordered the Valencia in thin crust, the California in deep dish and the Spicy Sausage pizza also in deep dish. The app was misleading in the delivery time as first it said 1 hour, but the pizza did not arrive until 2 hours later. Each time we checked the app, 5 or 10 or 15 minutes were added to our time. 
The deep dish pizza was tasty. The thin crust lacked a little sauce and in my opinion was not that great. 
I would try Little Star again since I've heard great things about it before.  I expect the restaurant was just having a busy night when I ordered.
author: Karla G.

description: Little star is awesome.  Good beers, friendly people.  I almost always get the large little star to go.  It is very good.  Not the cheapest place in the city, but definitely a cut above typical pizza.
author: David G.

description: Went with a party of six last Friday night to celebrate a birthday with friends as this is one of our favorite places to go for pizza. Our evening would have been a 10 on a scale from one to ten, however our server had the personality of a rock. I don't think he smiled once while waiting on us. We all were uncomfortable in asking for anything such as extra napkins because this guy was just going through the motions, but you could tell he really didn't want to be there. The pizza was great, as well as the wings. So if you go there don't expect service with a smile!
author: Susann R.

description:
YUM!! I love pizza and little star deep dish hits the spot. I absolutely love the dough with the cornmeal. I ordered a small half Classic and half Little Star and both were outstanding. The little star had a strong kick of garlic that was really good. 

Also ordered their wings that came with ranch/blue cheese dip and the wings were pippin hot - but it was very flavorful and crispy on the outside. Service was great and I am very satisfied with Little Star.. my mouth is watering thinking about the deep dish pizza..
author: Stephanie C.

description:
Unfortunately only got to try out Little Star once, given that we were a bit of a trek away in Corte Madera, but I often thought about returning. I'm a total sucker for a corn meal crust. I would say that the Classic deep dish (with mushroom and onions baked in) easily rivals Chicago. That corn meal really elevates all pizzas to the maximum though. 

It took a while to get our seat, but they got us taken care of at the bar with beer. Since it's deep dish we expected the pizza to take a while (and it did) so we ordered the spicy chicken wings to share. Pretty good, and definitely had some spice to them (although a single order is possibly too small an amount for 4 people). Like I said above, the pizza was stellar. Pizza cooking can be something of a great equalizer, but with that said, all the ingredients seemed fresh and of good quality. And, the portions were large enough that we took some home afterward.

This is a given for city folk but important to out of towners - this location is in the mission so parking is a headache and a half. Expect to circle several blocks several times.
author: Sharon R.

description: Ordered little stars spicy chicken wings from ubereats last night. I've been a big fan of little star for years and when the chicken wings arrived they tasted different from before, dry and dark (burnt) and slightly sour...my husband didn't eat it, and I ate them all. He is alright, and chicken wings are the only thins I ate and he didn't touch. This morning I am food poisoned and for a whole day I have been puking. Please make sure your chicken wings aren't marinated for days (in my case; they tasted expired but I thought it was alright) and don't serve your customer with them check quality of your food! As much as I love little stars pizza and everything, I am lying in bed whole day today thinking I really shouldn't risk it to go back! Sigh
author: Li L.

description: Stopped in for lunch from out of town and the pizza was amazing!! The deep dish is a must have! Service was good and the atmosphere was great along with the decor! If youre craving pizza its definitely a good stop!
author: Samantha F.

description:
I love this place. I am from out of town, but I come to the area once in a while. If I'm not at Pancho Villa for Mexican food, I am here for pizza, salad, and wings. 

We typically have to drive an hour to get into the city and then fight for parking to eat here. If you know how much I hate both sitting in traffic and parking in the city, you know what it means that I will do both of those just to dine here. 

What can I say? The thick crust is amazing. Even some of my coworkers from other places that have famous pizza say that it is as good or better.  During my latest visit, I finally got to try the thin crust. Wow!  Totally different from their thick variety, and good in different ways. The crust is amazingly crispy, while not being that ultra-thin crust type. Those types don't take toppings well, but the thin crust here stands up to a whole bunch of add-ons. I think we ordered 6 pizzas for our group on this latest visit: thick and thin versions of 3 varieties. I think they were "old school,"the  vegetarian, and "classic." We ordered extra so that we WOULD have leftovers. The thick crust holds up really well and makes for tasty leftovers. 

Don't miss the chicken wings. Yeah, everyone says that, right? I don't usually eat chicken wings anywhere, but these are special. There is some kind of spicy dry spice on them. They're not breaded, just touched with the spice and served with carrots and dressing. I eat them naked and let the others fight over the sauce and veggies. 

The garlic bread is a sliced loaf of bread with butter and a roasted head of large garlic. You butter the bread and squeeze the soft and tasty garlic cloves onto it. If you've never done that before, don't worry, the cooking mellows the garlic and is is truly wonderful.

The staff has always been nice, and even when we showed up with a party of 10, the service has been quick and efficient.

What are you waiting for? GO! Get some Little Star... and if you can't find one but can find a Blue Line, apparently, that's the name of their expansion outside the city.
author: Doug B.

description: At least they warn you that the "vegan" deep dish pizza isn't actually vegan. Apparently there's a butter coating on the deep dish pan. I don't want to sound like a vegan snob, but if you're also lactose intolerant this can be an issue. The food is good overall, but the service was slow and we were ignored a couple times. Also, found a long a black hair in our take out box.
author: Kayla F.

description: We stopped by this place for some quick take out as our last lunch stop in the beautiful city of San Fran, and it was easily one of the best (food) decisions we made throughout our stay at SF! Pro tip: They have a lunch special for personal pizzas @ ~$9 each, depending on deep dish vs thin crust. We are relatively small eaters but looking at the reviews here, decided to get one each and ended up finishing it all to the very last crumbs. The deep dish here was easily better than those we have tried in Chicago even. Strongly recommend!!
author: Ling Hui W.

description: Helllllo new favorite stop in the city! The broccolini is absolute heaven, there's roasted garlic all over the menu which is a dream come true. My boyfriend and I totally love this place. Great service, friendly staff, darn delicious pizza!
author: Ashley K.

description:
So delicious! We got the January Special and a custom deep dish and left fat and happy. Still have leftovers (forgot to take a pic of the whole meal) and they will be devoured soon. Service was really personable and nice! 

Can't wait to go back!

+ they have GF options! 
+ You can pay a dollar and play a while CD off the jukebox (: we did the dirty dancing soundtrack
author: Kristan S.

description:
Went here right after work so there was no line when we walked in.  This place really exceeded my expectations.  I heard a lot about and finally tried it with my co-worker.  We order a small Classic.  It was definitely enough for the two of us.  The Classic consisted of sausage, mushrooms, onions, green bell peppers.  For a small, the price is a $20. A large would be $7 more.  The real highlight of the dish was its cornmeal crust, it was freaking GOOD! 


If you miss Chicago style pizzas, this is the place!
author: Ellen Z.

description:
Amazing deep dish pizza. 

Their cornmeal crust has an amazing texture and is addictingly good. Plus they always use fresh cheese in their pizza underneath all that yummy tomato sauce: the kind that stretches for miles when it's melty. Order the large because even if you have leftovers (which almost never happens when I go), you'll be left with some great pizza for the next day.

Their spicy chicken wings are great as an appetizer too if you're really hungry. They have a great kick, and it comes with an addicting blue cheese dressing that I could eat by itself.

Wait times can be long at peak dinner hours, particularly during weekends. Ideally, you should go when it's less crowded, but if it's unavoidable, have a drink at the bar or walk around nearby on Valencia.
author: Sara L.

description:
Mmm... that cornmeal crust! I've actually never had deep dish pizza until Little Star Pizza. Funny thing is, I was visiting Chicago the week before thinking I should try deep dish pizza as a rite of food passage, but my friends who moved from SF to Chicago told me that no deep dish pizza in Chicago beats Little Star... hence, I held off and decided to try Little Star back home instead!

I assumed that I wouldn't like deep dish pizza because it just seemed too much, oily, and heavy... but surprisingly, Little Star does it right. I didn't fall into a food coma afterwards and I was yearning for more after every bite! I think what makes this pizza especially unique is its crust. It's crispy and a different texture.

The pizza also turned out super yummy, despite getting it delivered. I've been reading parking is a pain in this area so it makes me wonder how much better it is fresh and piping hot out of the oven!
author: Janet H.

description: Everyone knows this place is amazing. The deep dish is the best in SF mainly because of the cornmeal. I am leaving this amazeballs review because of the awesome customer service at this Valencia location. Every time I have come in person and ordered for pickup, the staff has been quick, accommodating and friendly. Today, they take the cake because I ordered for pickup with Eat24 and there was a small issues with orders coming through. They offered to refund me completely and upgrade to a large deep dish classic for free. Well done, Little Star. I was already a huge fan but you just made me a loyal customer for life. Thanks!
author: Kathy E.

description: Amazing place! Vegan pizza is easily the best in the city!! Very nice, funny, witty, receptive servers. Sean is our favorite waiter and we will definitely be returning very soon!
author: Lafonse C.

description:
Even though we live in the Phoenix area, my husband commutes to the Bay Area for work. I see all of his culinary exploits when he checks in online, and his SF friends have shown him some really terrific places.

Little Star is one of them. It is a cute little place that has excellent service and delicious food. Quite often, I find that deep dish pizza can just be so heavy and overdone. The ones we shared were delicious, which might be partly because of the cornmeal crust. I wouldn't say they make for a "light" meal, but everything from the sauce to the cheese to the crust is made perfectly. Our group also ordered a thin crust pie to compare /contrast and it was fantastic as well. I really liked the Green Goddess salad that we added to the order, and it was a nice, light side to add to the pizza.

Little Star cares about the small touches too: my diet Coke came with a frosted glass and a wedge of lemon. I highly recommend that you visit here and try it for yourself.
author: Christine B.

description: I don't eat pizza very often but tonight my wife and I really felt like having some. We ordered a 16 inch pizza for the two of us and some wings and a wedge salad. We were quoted 75 minutes for delivery, which was fine as we had ordered wary knowing Friday was a busy night for delivery. After an hour and a half we were notified that the order would be 20 minutes late. After that time came and went we were notified again that the order would be another 15 minutes late. Our food finally arrived after 2 hours and 20 minutes. It was completely cold. We contacted the company and were told that they could send us new food or credit us $10, but it would be another hour and a half. Making the time we would finally get to eat around 9:45ish. This was unacceptable so we microwaved the pizza we had and threw away the wing (cold wings are terrible)  and decided that we would not order from here again.
author: Rupert H.

description:
Ordered a thin crust (maybe that wasn't the wisest choice, since most patrons around had deep dish). And roasted cauliflower as a side, which was meh! Based on the other yelp reviews, came here expecting grandeur pizza; which it wasn't!! 
Beer selection was limited yet good. Waiter/ host (Dan, maybe) who seated was impatient and borderline rude. 

With our pizza being neither delicious nor memorable ----wouldn't want to come back ever again.
author: Alex P.

description:
I'll preface by saying that the only deep dish pizza I've ever had in my life is from Pizzeria Uno and I've never been to Chicago. With that said, I loved it! The dough wasn't overly buttery as I expected it to be. We went with the classic sausage one. It had nice crumbled sausage and a lovely slightly tart and chunky tomato sauce. Everything was also super fresh. 

My small qualm at Little Star was that the pound of spicy wings we got were so cold by the time it reached our table. I imagine that order was definitely up a long time ago. The flavor was good and true to the name in terms of spice level, which I was pleasantly surprised about. 

Overall, Little Star is simple and enjoyable. On a Friday night my partner and I waited about 40 minutes with beers in hand. The service was fast and friendly, and I'll probably bring my family here. Lately, that seems to be my marker for whether I give an establishment a good rating, haha
author: Priti K.

description:
My love for pizza is real, I've always wanted a heart shaped pizza and Little Star made it happen on Valentine's weekend!! My boyfriend contacted multiple pizza shops in San Francisco, after many phone calls, Little Star Pizza kindly fulfilled his request. 

He called the restaurant two weeks in advance and Lindsey answered the phone, she then asked the back kitchen if they were able to create a heart shaped pizza on a Saturday. The kitchen requested that he placed his order between 12-5pm. He called at 3pm to order a large pesto chicken pizza and added garlic and red bell peppers. They gave him the option to have the pizza picked up at a specific time - he chose 4pm.  

When I opened the box I was so amazed, the kitchen used pesto sauce to write "I love you". My boyfriend did not make this request but he was happy they added this to the pizza. After admiring the beauty, we devoured the pizza in one sitting. Little Star Pizza went out of their way to make my Valentine's weekend special :)
author: Sully B.

description:
I don't get "real" Chicago pizza. My favorite Chicago-style pizza has always been Zachary's from when I was in college. When I visited Chicago last year with my mom, I was on a mission to try the best places. I made it to two - Giordano's and Lou Malnotti's -- and I wasn't impressed by others. I actually didn't especially like the pizza at either place and thought the flavors were entirely disappointing. Chicago pizza, I thought, just wasn't for me.

On my last trip to SF, my friend told me to meet him here for some pizza. I didn't have high hopes, but he ordered the classic. On first bite, I loved it! Surprise surprise! I ate 2 or 3 pieces and took the rest to go. It was even good cold the next morning.

So, I guess I'm not a Chicago Chicago pizza gal. I'm a California Chicago pizza girl, and that's alright with me. :)
author: Lisa S.

description:
Then there was that time I called-in a small pizza to go from a very short-and-not-at-all sweet order taker. 

25 minutes, one rude waitress (not even a "thank you for the business," but she had time to be painfully pushy to the fellas who came in behind me) and $22 later I am on my second slice of the most boring, thrown-together pizza ever and wishing I could give it away. 

So, I fight thru as to not totally feel like my money was wasted. Now, my mouth tastes like ugh and I'm parched with thirst all day and into the night.

UPDATE: added two stars because the last couple of times the boss ordered the office lunch from here, the pizza and chicken was consistently good. Maybe I'll work up the nerve to visit the restaurant again and see if the service has improved as well!
author: Tony B.

description:
Have been here several times and love both the thin crust and deep dish pizzas.  They allow customization of your pizza which is great.  Nice beer selection as well.  The atmosphere is casual and lively as a pizza joint should be.

Minus 1 star because their reservation system seems flawed. I arrived exactly at my reservation time and was told they didn't have a table currently and it would be 15-20 minutes.  What is the point of making a reservation?   We were seated half an hour later which is way too long to make someone wait in my opinion.
author: Kristina H.

description:
5 stars for the food, 4 for the service. 

I LOVE the pizza here! The crust on the deep dish pizzas is the absolute best I've ever had. I've been here twice now and The California remains my favorite pizza option.

The service itself is good--the servers are attentive and approachable. But the wait can be long. I just went today (04/21) with a couple of friends, and we went around 6pm when the place was pretty empty. We got a table immediately, and it only started getting packed a little while after we ordered, so I expected us to get our order fairly quickly. But it still took close to an hour before we got our order.

So I do love the pizza here--it's my favorite of all the pizza places in SF (which is why I still give it a 5). The only downside is the long wait time.
author: Elaine L.

description: Incredible deep dish, I will definitely go back.
author: J P.

description: LOVE this place! Always go with the "Little Star" deep dish. So comforting and a perfect meal when paired with one of their salads.
author: S O.

description:
Little Star Pizza definitely has one of those appeals to it as a good pizza place. Luckily, able to accommodate our large party, we came on a Saturday evening around dinner time. 

FOOD: Mediterranean Chicken pizza for us at 12" for a party of four and the other group split a pizza on the other side. I would say, for four people, 12" is a good amount. Perhaps with an appetizer, you could be satisfied. Also got the garlic bread appetizer, pretty good since they bake the whole bulb of garlic, which is always superb to have that nice garlicky taste. The ingredient quality is good and the chicken was pretty tasty as well. I have to say that I was pleasantly surprised and satisfied.  

SERVICE: Standard, nothing superb. 

Little Star proves to be competitive in its ability to serve deep dish style pizza. As good as Chicago's? I will have my own opinions, but Little Star does the job right.
author: Albert H.

description: Raven and Ray are amazing at their job, always happy definitely coming back to see them :)! Best customer service in the mission!!!
author: Stephen G.

description:
Really good pizza. Like incredible. Tastes like a lighter version of Zachary's. I think it's the crust that does it.  Can I consider this a health food? 

I've never been to Chicago but I can't imagine they can beat this
author: Shoole S.

description:
Because of the ratings, we all expected great pizzas.

The crust is the worst I have ever had.    It is as hard as day old Ciabatta bread, like a rock.   The Greek salad was more like a house salad with mostly romaine, a few strands of onion and 3 cherry tomatoes cut up.   That's it!!   The dressing was really sour.  It didn't have any flavor other than the taste of vinegar.    We had the August pizza which is vegetarian and the all meat pizza.  Both had rock like crusts.   The chicken wing was okay, but a bit burned and very dry.    
I guess I could have given them two stars, but the great reviews that got us there needs some major correction, so people don't continue to have great expectations and then be let down.   

The beer and the service was good.
author: Doris A.

description: Went here for a second time in like 5 years. I eat at Patxi's more often for deep dish. What is better--Little Star or Patxi's--the truth is..either one is good for deep dish. The prices are comparable and the pizzas taste the same.
author: Denise C.

description: Tried to order from them but their deliver service made a huge screw up, didn't fix it and we never got our order. Caviar is a joke. You lost a customer because of them.
author: lori s.

description: hands down best pizza i've had in san francisco's, considering you more than likely will come here to sit down and dine there is not option in the city that goes a better deep dish!! Capos in north beach is not even as good this location and the mission location (been to both!!) is optimal for weekend dinning as it is not super crowded so you can fine a spot to sit at! Quick pizza options like slice house and nizarios exist for a specific reason, grab a quick slice and jet! But this is a goo to spot for dining in with a salad, pizza and beer! Take your girlfriend
author: John R.

description:
I looked up "best pizza in SF" and Little Star showed up.  We got the Classic- sausage, bell peppers, and onions, and of course my fav... Cheese pizza!  Both were good, really crispy!  We had it delivered via Caviar and it took about an hour to arrive.  

I think they are known for deep dish pizza, but we got all thin crust.  I've heard raving reviews about the deep dish, and even though I don't usually like deep dish...I'm definitely going to try it next time!
author: Lyn C.

description:
Had a bit of a rough start here, but our server made it a point to acknowledge & compensate for any oversight.  

Having bday dinner plans later, we ordered light.  Small deep dish 1/2 Meatball Special & 1/2 Little Star with added Pepperoni.  We both ordered beer, and enjoyed ourselves while waiting for the pizza.  

When it arrived, we were both disappointed that it was BARELY warm!!  Even though it tasted good, the temperature made it less appealing & seem old, or like leftovers.  Given the wait-time issues when we first arrived, I thought maybe they had tried to hurry our pizza so we weren't waiting for too much longer??  Not sure, but if that was the case, I applaud their effort, but would have rathered wait a bit longer for a hot pizza.  

Would def try them again though :)
author: Kai R.

description:
I've had a number of people recommend Little Star Pizza when the inevitable topic of best pizza in SF comes up. I had a hard time believing anything tops Tony's but I thought it would be prudent to find out. I still maintain that Tony's is the best, but I will give credit where it is due.

Little Star does not have great pizza. For the most part, it is an average deep dish which is probably outshone by other deep dish pizzas in the city. What is does have though, is an absolutely delicious and unique crust on its deep dish pizza. The corn meal crust is just perfect and is definitely a must try. I stay away from excessive carbs where I can and therefore usually avoid crusts on most pizzas but I simply couldn't stop eating it here. The flavor of the corn meal comes out wonderfully.

Overall, the crust on this pizza is what you need to come here for. Know that the rest will be average, but you must try this unique aspect on their pizzas. "I'm a fan."
author: Mark O.

description: I am originally from Chicago and I love finding dee dish pizza in hopes of finding something that reminds me of home! The pizza is good! Team sauce is definitely home made and the ingredients are fresh! I really did like the pizza! This has to be the best deep dish pizza away from Chicago! The reason why I am giving it 3 stars is because of the service! Our waiter didn't use a pen or paper to write down our order and got it wrong! He had a face said I don't want to be here I don't care if you want or like your food just leave me a tip! He didn't smile and I don't know about you but to me you set the mood of your customer you determine if I am going to buy more such as alcohol appetizers or desserts! A smile goes a long way! He never checked up on us! I literally had on cup of water my whole meal! We literally had waiter envy because our counter table had awesome service! Fix that and we would definitely come back and give you guys a second chance!
author: Kataz T.

description: I had the vegan pizza, and it was luxurious. My step brother thought he came here before, but now he knows.
author: Ralph B.

description: Ordered through eat24 for pick up. Left my house after 25 minutes and sat in the restaurant for 45 minutes. Apparently they hadn't even started making the pizza when i arrived (at the estimated time THEY provided me).
